Labels.Name: Name
Labels.Author: Author
Labels.UnsavedMessage: Warning: Leaving this page without saving will result in the loss of any unsaved changes. Please make sure to save your work before navigating away.

ErrorMessages.404RouteNotKnown: Sorry, there's nothing at this address.

CopyItem.Title: Copy Item
CopyItem.Description: Select a group to copy this item to

ImportConfig.Title: Import Config
ImportConfig.Description: This allows you to import a configuration from an older Fenrus install into the new .NET version.

Labels.PageDescription: This page lets you manage calendar feeds.  These feeds will appear in your calendar but will not be editable.
Labels.PageDescription-System: This page lets you manage calendar feeds that will be available to all users.  These feeds will appear in their calendar but will not be editable.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Name-Help: The name of the calendar feed
Fields.Url-Help: The URL to the calendar feed
Fields.Type-Help: The type of calendar feed this is, if the type you want to use is not in this list, then it is not supported.
Fields.CacheMinutes-Help: The number of minutes to cache this feed for before refreshing it, keep this number high to reduce excess querying of the calendar data.
Fields.Color-Help: The color to show these events in.  Leave blank to use the default color.

Fields.Address-Help:
The URL of the site to open, you will likely need to use a https URL.
Not all sites will allow you to open them in an IFrame, and may need to be switched to an external type.
Fields.AddressExternal-Help: The URL to the webpage that will be opened.
Fields.AddressVnc-Help: The address for the VNC server
Fields.AddressSsh-Help: The address for the SSH server, can be in the format user@host or user:password@host
Fields.AddressDocker-Help: The name of the docker container.
Fields.DockerCommand-Help: The docker command to run to open the terminal, if in doubt try /bin/bash, if that fails try /bin/sh

Labels.PageDescription:
This page lets you create Dashboards.  Having more than one dashboard will let you switch between them on the home screen.

To add items to your Dashboard, first create a Group containing the items you wish to add.  Then you can add that new Group to a Dashboard.

Messages.GuestPageDescription:
This page lets you configure the Guest dashboard, the dashboard that will be shown to users if they have not signed in.  This is also the default dashboard set for new users.

You can disable this dashboard if you wish for users to login before using Fenrus.
Messages.RemoveGroupMessage: Do you want to remove the group ''{name}''?

Labels.PageDescription: This page lets you configure Docker instances which can be used in Apps and Links to open terminals into.

Fields.ShowGroupTitle-Help: Whether or not to show the group title

Labels.Author: Author
Labels.SshDescription:
By configuring SSH for this item, this will allow you to terminal into the item.

If username or password is blank, you will be prompted for this information.
Labels.DockerDescription: Here you can configure Docker settings for this item, which will allow you to terminal into the docker container.
Labels.DockerTerminalDescription: Note: If SSH is configured you will not be able to connect user this Docker connection.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Debug-Help: Will show extra debugging information in the 'Test' result.
Fields.Monitor-Help: When enabled this item will have its up-time monitored
Fields.SshAddress-Help: Optional address for connecting to a SSH terminal.
Fields.SshUsername-Help: Optional Username for connecting to a SSH terminal.
Fields.SshPassword-Help: Optional Password for connecting to a SSH terminal.
Fields.ApiUrl-Help:
Optional URL to use to contact the API if different that the URL above.
The main URL will be where the user is taken when the item is clicked.
Fields.DockerUid-Help: The Docker instance this connects to.
Fields.DockerContainer-Help: The name of the Docker container to connect to

Labels.PageDescription:
This page lets you create groups which can be used on Dashboards.

A group will not appear by itself, it must be added to a dashboard.
Labels.PageDescription-System:
This page lets you configure groups that will be available to all users and will be available to use on the Guest dashboard.

If you disable a group here that group will become unavailable to all users using it.

Labels.PasswordReset: Password has been reset.  A new email has been email to you and printed to the console.
Labels.PasswordResetTokenInvalid: Invalid password reset token, or password reset has expired.
Labels.PasswordResetSent: If the user exists, a password reset will have been sent to your email address or printed to the console.
Labels.ForgotPasswordDescription: Enter your username or email address and a password reset link will be emailed to you and printed to the console log.

Labels.PageDescription: This page allows you to change your user profile settings.
Labels.PageDescription-Calendar:
This allows you to customize the calendar source for your personal calendar.

You can specify a CalDAV source and if so, all events will be saved to that source, otherwise they will be saved into Fenrus directly.
Labels.PageDescription-FileStorage: This allows you to customize the file storage source you can either use the built-in locally hosted file system storage or use an external WebDAV source.
Labels.PageDescription-Email: This allows you to configure an IMAP server to use for retrieving your emails.
Labels.PageDescription-Apps: This allows you to configure that apps that are shown in the Cloud drawer.

Messages.PasswordValidationError: Password must be at least 4 characters long
Messages.PasswordMismatch: New and Confirm password do not match
Messages.OtherUserExists: Another user with this username already exists

Fields.Email-Help: This email address will be used for password resets
Fields.CalendarUrl-Help: If using a known provider just enter the base URL for the calendar. For example, https://mynextcloud.com
Fields.CalendarName-Help: The name of the calendar, if not set the first calendar found will be used.
Fields.FileStorageUrl-Help: If using a known provider just enter the base URL for the file storage. For example, https://mynextcloud.com
Fields.EmailImapServer-Help: The IMAP server address used to receive emails
Fields.EmailSmtpServer-Help: The SMTP server address used to send emails

Labels.PageDescription:
This page lets you configure search engines that can be used on the home screen.

If you do not configure any and have no system search engines configured, the search box will not appear on the home screen.

To switch to an non-default search engine on the home screen type in the search engine Shortcut followed by a space.
Labels.PageDescription-System: This page lets you configure system wide search engines that will be available to all users and guests on the system.

Fields.Name-Help: The name of the search engine
Fields.Url-Help: The URL of the search engine.  Note %s will be replaced with the search string
Fields.Shortcut-Help: The shortcut for this search engine.  Typing this shortcut then space will switch the search to use this search engine

Labels.PageDescription: This page allows you to configure system wide settings
Labels.SmtpDescription: Configure an SMTP server, this will be used to send password reset emails.
Labels.CloudDescription: Configure which cloud features you wish end user to be able to use, the cloud is the users side panel and gives them access to these features.
Labels.Importing: Importing previous configuration, this may take a while, please wait.

Messages.TestEmailSent: Test email sent to Sender, check your email to confirm working.
Messages.UpdateRequired: Your version of Fenrus is out of date.  You must update Fenrus to get the latest apps.
Messages.AppsUpdated: Updated {total} applications {newCount, plural, zero {} one {(1 new app)} other {({newCount} new apps)}}

Fields.SmtpSenderHelp: The email address Fenrus will send emails from.

Labels.PageDescription: This page lets you manage users for Fenrus.

Fields.FullName-Help: The users full name or the name to display for them, if left blank their username will be their display name
